meanings.definition: A woman who has taken vows or made a solemn promise
meanings.sent1: The votaresses at the convent dedicated their lives to serving others.
meanings.sent2: The votaresses in the monastery led a life of prayer and contemplation.
meanings.sent3: The votaresses promised to always keep the peace, even during disagreements.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to the cause made her a true votaress of justice.
meanings.sent5: The votaresses' dedication to their vows shone brightly in their daily actions.

meanings.definition: Women who are devoted to a particular cause or belief
meanings.sent1: The environmental votaresses worked tirelessly to protect the local wildlife.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a votaress of education, always advocating for better schools.
meanings.sent3: The votaresses of charity organized a successful fundraiser for the homeless.
meanings.sent4: In the world of art, she was a votaress of creativity and innovation.
meanings.sent5: The votaresses' unwavering dedication to their cause inspired many in the community.
